question: During transcription the DNA strand with $3^{\prime}\rightarrow5^{\prime}$ polarity of the structural gene always acts as a template because
choices: Enzyme DNA dependent RNA polymerase always catalyse polymerisation in bioth the directions.
Enzyme DNA dependent RNA polymerase always catalyse the polymerisation $5^{\prime}\rightarrow3^{\prime}$ directions.
Nucleotides of DNA strand with $5^{\prime}\rightarrow3^{\prime}$ are transferred to mRNA.
Enzyme DNA dependent RNA polymerase always catalyse the polymerisation $3^{\prime}\rightarrow5^{\prime}$ directions.
explanation: The DNA-dependent RNA polymerase catalyses polymerization only in the $5' \rightarrow 3'$ direction.
Therefore, the DNA strand with $3' \rightarrow 5'$ polarity must act as the template.
